title: Walter Model
summary: Otto Moritz Walter Model (IPA: [ˈmoːdəl]; 24 January 1891 – 21 April 1945) was a German field marshal during World War II.  Although he was a hard-driving, aggressive panzer commander early in the war, Model became best known as a practitioner of defensive warfare.  His relative success as commander of the Ninth Army in the battles of 1941–1942 determined his future career path.
